Fun - We Are Young

Notes*: 
     -The Gm and Am at the end of verse 1 and
     the outro are just the triads of Gm and Am
     the low note of the chord isnt necessarily 
     an A or a G.

     -I would only play the slash chords if your
     either trying to be super accurate or playing
     piano. Otherwise this isn't ease to sing and play

     -The Guitar during verse two plays power chords
     rather than the whole chord.

     -To make the song even easier you could tranpose
     the chords down 5 half-steps and play with a capo
     on the fifth fret.

content.text:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                    THE FUNERAL - Band of Horses
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tabbed by: jvwald

This tab is based on this YouTube video:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0KL4bBiDCI0

I’ll start by saying that I don’t know why Ben plays it this way. It's
clear when you watch him play it live like in the video above that he's
not in standard tuning. And if someone uses such a non-standard tuning,
you would assume that it's because it makes the song sound so much different
or better than standard tuning. I think this song sounds just as good in
standard tuning like it is shown in other tabs on this site. One guess is
that Ben is a self described "terrible guitar player" and maybe this tuning
makes it easier to play and easier for him to locate where he is on the
fretboard.

I realize the last thing this site needs is another version of this song.
I guess I just thought it would be interesting to figure out and post this
tab the way he plays it, even though I would probably never go through the
trouble to retune this to play it "correctly." If anyone has any suggestions
for changes to this tab or if you have thoughts about why this odd tuning,
I’d be happy to hear them. If you do have suggestions, please refer to
videos of the band playing live.

Capo: III

Tuning: FFD#G#A#E (he doesn't appear to play either the high or low E string
but you can tune the low E up to F if you want for a fuller sound on the
FII chord)
